text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to explicitly cite section 76(6) of the Criminal Justice and Immigration Act 2008. The candidate response discusses the statutory test by citing section 3 of the Criminal Law Act 1967 and then relies on common law cases (R v Williams (Gladstone), R v Palmer, R v Keane, R v Owino) to discuss the impact of a mistaken belief. It fails to mention or cite s. 76(6) of the CJIA 2008, which is the specific statutory provision governing mistaken belief in self-defence.", "criterion_id": "2bc01107-d10e-487f-89ac-7cb0d7c67d08"}
